p: Algae oil and several di-acids from renewable sources (dimer acid, itaconic acid, maleic acid, and phthalic anhydride) were used to synthesize alkyd and polyesteramide polyols for PU coatings with anticorrosive and antibacterial properties [ 321]. Bactericidal properties were tested against E. coli and S. aureus by turbidimetry, showing that the uncoated polyols and the algae oil fatty amide (AOFA) and monoglyceride (MG) coatings had more bacterial attachment and less inhibition efficiency compared to algae-oil-modified PU coatings, since algae-oil-modified PU coatings have a higher percentage of oleic acid, which inhibits the bacterial growth.
